intro: Picris hieracioides subsp. grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered groundsel, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its showy yellow flowers bloom in summer, and the leaves are lance-shaped with a rough texture. It is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and has some traditional medicinal uses.
